description: At the edge of the city, Harbour Road winds along the shoreline,
attractive for tourtists and useful for marchants.  The sea goes on
for miles to the south, spreading out disappearing over the horizon,
and the constant sound of the waves drifts through the air.  Running
between the water and the road, a stone wall stands a few feet high
and keeps the tide from breaking onto the shore.  To the north is the
Harbour Master's building.
55882.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DHarbour Road{x

description: Lined with trees, this broad street is clean but well-used, the
stones showing only small signs of their wear.  As it winds its way
across the city, it passes many smaller homes and shops.  At almost
all hours someone can be found wandering this street, either on their
way to and from the market or the harbour.
55871.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55919.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55924.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Jammed with desks, shelves, cabinets and people, the Harbour
Master's building is never quiet.  Voices cry out as people struggle
to hold their own conversations over the din of the crowd as captains,
merchants, clerks, and apprentices all do their business.  Every desk
in the place is covered with mounds of paper and books, and the walls
are covered with means of keeping records.
55911.name: {DThe {YH{yarbour {YM{yaster{Y'{ys {DBuilding{x

description: Breaking away from Merchant's Way, a broad street leads toward the
dockyards.  The short wall following along the coast curves with the
shoreline, running parallel the road, and a tall fence runs around the
dockyards to the southeast.  Across the harbour, the temple of
Umberlee can be seen rising on wide pillars out of the water.
55859.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: The smoothed and worn cobblestones of the Road of Travellers run
along from east to west.  To the north is the famous {WE{wlfsong {YT{yavern{x,
the largest and most popular tavern in all of Baldur's Gate.  It is a
great place for hearing rumours and gossip about the city.
55811.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Shielded from the spray of the sea by Umberlee's temple, the
narrow road follows the wall of the temple along the shore.  Though
difficult to see, the sound of the sea is easily heard as it laps
against the far side of the temple.  The air is thick with the scent
of salt water and the cries of seagulls, and the sounds from the docks
can be heard in the distance.
55901.name: {DThe {YS{youth {YP{yath{x

description: This small building is typical of the local housing in Baldur's
Gate.  There is a pair of partitions making walls in the room.  To the
eastern side, there is a small kitchen with a standard stove.  To the
western side, are two beds behind the partition.  A small fireplace
brings warmth to the humble abode.
55840.name: A Small House

description: This small building is typical of the local housing in Baldur's
Gate.  There is a pair of partitions making walls in the room.  To the
eastern side, there is a small kitchen with a standard stove.  To the
western side, are two beds behind the partition.  A small fireplace
brings warmth to the humble abode.
55839.name: A Small House

description: Stretched out to the west, the city of Baldur's Gate stands vigil
beside the ocean.  The smell of salt water lingers in the air, and the
cry of seagulls echoes faintly from a distance.  Tucked between the
road and the Easter Gatehouse, a small house sits to the north, a sign
beside the door inviting passers-by.
55801.name: {YB{yefore {DThe {YE{yastern {YG{yatehouse{x

description: A large thoroughfair for the citizens of Baldur's Gate, Balduran
Way is a wide and busy street.  The stones of the road are dirty and
worn but the street is kept even.  Small houses on the east side of
the road are built together into a large building; to the west is a
row of small, old homes.
55868.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: Running from the harbour to the residential part of the city,
Merchant's Way is a broad and winding street paved with well-kept
stones.  Within sight of the Market Square, some merchants have been
known to set their booths up along the fringes of the street in an
attempt to stand apart from the crowd and be the first to catch
incoming business.  Lamps also line the street, keeping the busy
thoroughfare lit at all times of day.
55874.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: The smoothed and worn cobblestones of the Road of Travellers run
along from east to west.  The large building to the north is the
Elfsong Tavern, its entrance is just east of here.
55812.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Lined with trees and small homes to the north, the South Central
Corridor runs through the center of the city.  The street blocks are
maintained well, scuffed but clean, barely showing the amount of use
put to the road.  To the south stands the headquarters of the Flaming
Fist, a large building dotted with windows that face over the
corridor.
55928.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: Shielded from the spray of the sea by Umberlee's temple, the narrow
road follows the wall of the temple along the shore.  Though difficult
to see, the sound of the sea is easily heard as it laps against the
far side of the temple.  The air is thick with the scent of salt water
and the cries of seagulls, and the sounds from the docks can be heard
in the distance.
55885.name: {bU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{B'{bs {YP{yassage{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55916.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: {g     {G.{g-{G"{g`.-{G'{g-.       {wThis road alongside the eastern city wall
{g  .-'.-.%_.- {G,{g )  {wof Baldur's Gate is lined with beautiful and
{g (_{G.{g ){R%{g(  .'{R%{g  ,) {wtall oak trees. They cast an inviting shadow
{g   (.-, {R%{g)'{G.{g _.)  {wdown on the cobblestone  pathway below.  The
{g    '-.{y%{g\{y%{g/-{G'     {wroad is named after Cloakwood. This shadowed
{y        %%        {wand dark  forest is located southwest of the
{y        %%        {wcity.  The trees are grown from acorns found
{g      .,{y%%{g._     {win Cloakwood, some say they are magical.{x
55807.name: {YC{yloakwood {YC{ylose{x

description: Made entirely out of logs, the room is close.  A large fireplace
sits against one wall, remnants of a burned down fire in the hearth,
and a large painting is on the wall above it.  In the painting is a
vast forest, lush and green with a path leading off into the distance.
On either side of the room is a closed door, and a pair of comfortable
looking chairs sit in front of the fireplace.
55944.name: {YN{yature{Y'{ys {GS{ganctum{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55918.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: Following beside the city wall, the small, unadorned road connects
two larger routes to each other.  A large building looms over the
street from the south, looking as though it is made up of many smaller
houses.  Between the wall and the building, it is well shaded from the
sun, lit by the lamp posts that run along either side of the road.
55864.name: {YC{yommoner{y'{ys {YP{yassage{x

description: Lined with trees and small homes to the north, the South Central
Corridor runs through the center of the city.  The street blocks are
maintained well, scuffed but clean, barely showing the amount of use
put to the road.  To the south stands the headquarters of the Flaming
Fist, a large building dotted with windows that face over the
corridor.
55931.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: With the view of the sea stretching out to the south, the narrow
street is frequented by visitors to Baldur's Gate.  Decorative
cobblestone makes up the street, kept clean of most debree, and lamp
posts light the route.  Seagulls are often found perched on the short
wall that prevents the surf from crashing up onto the road; their
cries sound high overhead.
55906.name: {YS{youth {YS{ytreet{x

description: A small path north from the cobblestone road leads to the Blade and
Stars, a somewhat low price, low life inn.  The road continues east
towards the city wall.
55819.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: This is the southwest corner of Sorcerous Sundries.  Intricate
patterns of colour shine through the stain glass dome ceiling to
illuminate the room.  Over to the east is the main entrance to the
shopping dome while to the north, it is possible to see an ancient
elven mage resting, ready to teach new recruits the arts of wizardry.
There is another large desk in this part of the shop, and behind the
desk is a tall wooden cabinet, with glass doors, showing an array of
wands.
55844.name: Sorcerous Sundries

description: The bustling South Central Corridor, a wide and clean street, runs
through this section of Baldur's Gate.  Though often used, the street
is maintained well, often tidied and well kept.  Lamp posts run along
the road, useful though undecorative, brightly lit during the night.
A path breaks off to the north, leading to the Central Gatehouse.
55895.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.
55836.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: A long building sits to the north of the road here, windows
decorated with transparent curtains and the door slightly ajar.
Hanging above the door, a wood carved sign reads "Ye Olde Inn."
Surrounded by homes, the inn is popular, its location giving patrons
access to a major thoroughfaire of the city.
55909.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55936.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Running along the coastline, the street is paralleled by a low wall
breaking the tide before it washes onto the road.  To the south is a
vast view of the sea; to the north, a log building has been built.  A
single level, it stretches out, windows and door both outlined by
engraved woodwork in an intricate pattern.  The windows are opened
wide, one to each side of the door.
55905.name: {YS{youth {YS{ytreet{x

description: Here it is possible to see a large building that looks like lots
of smaller houses joined together, over to the north.  It is only
visible here because there is no house to the north unlike the rest of
the street.  The large set of houses seem to join onto the back of the
other houses in this alley as though they were terraced.
55830.name: {DShadow's Alley{x

description: Cutting through the city, the road is broad and carefully
maintained.  Lamp posts run along the street, powered by Makou; a row
of quaint homes sits to the north, each with a walk leading to the
road.
55908.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: Drifing away from the coastline, the road comes to an end and
meets with Umberlee's Passage, which winds its way around the large
temple of Umberlee.  The sound of the sea is still prominent here, the
water disappearing among the pillars of the temple.  Seagulls are
often found atop the temple.  To the north sits the Iron Throne, a
large and impressive building surrounded by an ominous wall.
55884.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DHarbour Road{x

description: Following beside the city wall, the small, unadorned road connects
two larger routes to each other.  A large building looms over the
street from the south, looking as though it is made up of many smaller
houses.  Between the wall and the building, it is well shaded from the
sun, lit by the lamp posts that run along either side of the road.
55863.name: {YC{yommoner{y'{ys {YP{yassage{x

description: This alley is narrow, dark, and aptly named.  This is the place
dangerous people often hang out, with the protection of the Iron
Throne close by to the west.  Gang members and drug dealers are
frequently found in this little alley, just south of the main central
corridor, in South Baldur's Gate.
55892.name: {DAssassin's Alley{x

description: The small room is packed with clothing for all ages, from
children's shorts to adults' swimsuits.  A large window facing the
street is decorated with a single dummy wearing a sundress, and
similar dummies stand in the corners demonstrating various styles.
Clothes hang on hangers on the wall and on racks scattered around the
room.  A long counter runs along one wall, and a door leads off the
wall opposite the entrance.
55920.name: {YS{yeaside {YS{ytyles{x

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.
55837.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: North of this wide thoroughfaire sits the headquarters of the
Flaming Fist.  A short path leads up to its double entrances, small
shrubs standing to either side of the pair of doors.  Over the doors,
a large sign is engraved with the name of the company, and second
floor windows open above the sign.
55939.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Running from the harbour to the residential part of the city,
Merchant's Way is a broad and winding street paved with well-kept
stones.  Within sight of the Market Square, some merchants have been
known to set their booths up along the fringes of the street in an
attempt to stand apart from the crowd and be the first to catch
incoming business.  Lamps also line the street, keeping the busy
thoroughfare lit at all times of day.
55877.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: North of this wide thoroughfaire sits the headquarters of the
Flaming Fist.  A short path leads up to its double entrances, small
shrubs standing to either side of the pair of doors.  Over the doors,
a large sign is engraved with the name of the company, and second
floor windows open above the sign.
55940.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: The scent of a forest is strong here, the wooden logs of the walls
giving off a distinct aroma.  Narrow but long, the room has a good
deal of open floor space, and a training dummy sits off to one side.
Furniture fashioned of wood sits around the room, chairs, benches, and
tables scattered near the walls.  A large map is framed against one
wall, detailing the Realms.
55946.name: {DThe {GR{ganger{G'{gs {DGrove{x

description: Meeting up with the South Path, the street moves away from the
Temple of Umberlee and meanders along the shore.  A scenic route by
the sea and so near the temple, it is kept clean and often frequented
by sightseers and visitors to the city.  The temple is to the east,
standing on tall poles that extend down into the water; the surf
crashes against them, the spray leaping upward toward the street.
55903.name: {DThe {YS{youth {YP{yath{x

description: Following beside the city wall, the small, unadorned road connects
two larger routes to each other.  A large building looms over the
street from the south, looking as though it is made up of many smaller
houses.  Between the wall and the building, it is well shaded from the
sun, lit by the lamp posts that run along either side of the road.
55862.name: {YC{yommoner{y'{ys {YP{yassage{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55848.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: The large road of Balduran Way comes to an end at the city wall,
turning off onto Commoner's Road to the east.  A small house sits
tucked beside the wall, quaint and ordinary though looking a little
run down.  Sitting on the corner of the intersection is a lam ppost.
55865.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55927.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: This is the end of Merchant's Way.  The Road of Travellers joins to
the east, while Bard's Crescent starts to the south.
55860.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55846.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: The Road of Travellers runs southward here, towards the far south
of the city.  That is where dockyards, the harbour and the Blade and
Stars inn can be found.
55816.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: This small house is almost set up like a laboratory.  There are
benches set up with all sorts of arcane objects for study at the rear
of the house.  A small kitchen unit on the south wall is set up for
cooking but is more used for magic experiments.  There is a small bed
along the north wall behind a wooden partition.  There is a strange
rotting smell coming from somewhere in the house.
55849.name: Nemphre's House

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.
55834.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: The road curves round to the south here.  To the north is a great
dome, with a very beautiful stained glass roof.  A signpost is here
giving information on the dome.  A lot of the people around this part
of the road wear mage's robes.
55815.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: The Road of Travellers is a cobblestone road on the southeast side
of Baldur's Gate.  The road continues west and south of here, while
Cloakwood Close is just to the east.  Tracks in the road indicate it
is well travelled.
55810.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: The dockyards come to a fairly abrupt ending here.  The only path
is the path back west to Bard's Crescent.  Many crates are piled high
here, storing many supplies, foods, gems, trinkets, clothing and
possibly even weapons or armour.  Sounds come from all around; the
constant cries of seagulls, the noise of crates being loaded and
unloaded, and the dock workers occasionally shouting or yelling
something to eachother.
55942.name: {wD{Dockyards

description: The city wall comes to an end here, a tall turret reaching skyward.
A sign hangs above the broad door welcoming wanderers to the Gatehouse
Tavern, and the windows are draped within by simple curtains.  Lapping
against the shore, the sea is kept off of the street by a low wall
that runs along the coastline.
55852.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: {DThis small abode is outfitted for the study of necromancy.  A stone
altar in the center is set up for ritual sacrifice and the raising of
the dead.  There is a shrine to Orcus, the god of the undead set by
the altar.  Pictures depict life, death, and the raising of the dead
into an army of darkness.  {x
55850.name: Tran's House

description: Near to the water, South Street is a narrow cobblestone road that
is both scenic and useful.  Lamp posts dot both sides of the road, and
more often than not, at least one person can be found wandering this
path.  To the west, a small building sits with its double-doors open;
from within echoes the sound of clashing metal and the shouts of
voices.  A sign on the door is marked with a crossed staff and sword.
55922.name: {YS{youth {YS{ytreet{x

description: A large thoroughfair for the citizens of Baldur's Gate, Balduran
Way is a wide and busy street.  The stones of the road are dirty and
worn but the street is kept even.  Small houses on the east side of
the road are built together into a large building; to the west is a
row of small, old homes.
55869.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55926.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Lined with trees and small homes to the north, the South Central
Corridor runs through the center of the city.  The street blocks are
maintained well, scuffed but clean, barely showing the amount of use
put to the road.  To the south stands the headquarters of the Flaming
Fist, a large building dotted with windows that face over the
corridor.
55929.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: Running along the shore, a low wall separates the street from the
sea.  A tall fence casts a shadow over this section of Bard's
Crescent, sounds echoing from the dockyards beyond.  Occaisionally,
bards will set up between the fence and the road, complementing the
vast view of the sea with their trade.
55856.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: The street turns here, breaking away from the sea shore.  Tapering
slowly, the wall that separated street from surf angles downward and
comes to an end.  A small beach has been left untouched by the city, a
popular draw for many tourists, and it is often found crowded.  Not
far to the north, the headquarters of the Flaming Fist can be seen at
the end of the road.
55921.name: {YS{youth {YS{ytreet{x

description: This small building is typical of the local housing in Baldur's
Gate.  There is a pair of partitions making walls in the room.  To the
eastern side, there is a small kitchen with a standard stove.  To the
western side, are two beds behind the partition.  A small fireplace
brings warmth to the humble abode.
55838.name: A Small House

description: Not very wide, the South Path is hardly a grand street but it is
clean and scenic.  Nearby, the sound of the sea floats in the air, and
the smell of salt lingers in the air.  To the north, a small building
sits with a model standing in the window wearing a sundress and a
large hat.  A small alley cuts away to the east.
55899.name: {DThe {YS{youth {YP{yath{x

description: All around you energy swirls and crackles.  This place has an aura
of power in it.  You are floating in a powerful mantic current that
makes it hard to move properly, as though you are floating inside some
kind of underwater lava, cold to the touch.  Sparks of energy arc
towards you and towards you and all around.  Floating near you is the
ancient elven mage, ready to train you.
55943.name: The {CA{cn{gc{Gi{ge{cn{Ct {WE{wlven {CM{ca{gg{Ge's {BTraining Chamber{x

description: Along the beautiful harbour road, the sea spreads out for miles to
the south.  Along the edge of the road is a stone wall about waist
height for a human, preventing waves crashing into the shores.  To the
south, a large temple rests, built on large woodan pillars sunk into
the sea floor.  That is the temple of Umberlee, one of the largest
temples in Baldur's Gate.
55883.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DHarbour Road{x

description: A large thoroughfair for the citizens of Baldur's Gate, Balduran
Way is a wide and busy street.  The stones of the road are dirty and
worn but the street is kept even.  Small houses on the east side of
the road are built together into a large building; to the west is a
row of small, old homes.
55866.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: Streets come together here to form a vast, open market.  The air is
filled with the sounds of the nearby harbour, and during the day the
calls of merchants lift above the din of a gathered crowd.  As an open
market, there are no set booths, but travellers and locals alike hock
their wears to each day's crowd.  Though most is typical, more rare
finds can be made as merchants from all parts pass through the city,
and the mix of local and foreign products keeps the crowd coming for
more.
55888.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DMarket Square{x

description: {DThis alleyway is very narrow.  There are tall fences running up
along both sides of the path.  There is a small doorway to the west
leading to a little house.  It is dark and looks neglected.  {x
55828.name: {DA{Y N{yarrow{D Alley{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55923.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.
55803.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: In the shadow of the Harbour Master's building, a few merchants
have been known to set up their shop, keeping a bit of distance
between themselves and the crowd of the nearby market.  The road is
broad, lined with lamp posts and the odd tree here and there.  A row
of small, well-kept houses sits to the north.
55890.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: The Harbour Road lies to the west of here.  This is where merchants
can bring their goods from their ships to transport to the rest of the
city and beyond.
55878.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: Shielded from the spray of the sea by Umberlee's temple, the narrow
road follows the wall of the temple along the shore.  Though difficult
to see, the sound of the sea is easily heard as it laps against the
far side of the temple.  The air is thick with the scent of salt water
and the cries of seagulls, and the sounds from the docks can be heard
in the distance.
55886.name: {bU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{B'{bs {YP{yassage{x

description: Coming to a corner, the South Central Corridor meets with the
beginning of Flaming Fist Crescent.  Broad large roads, they break off
of each other, running along the edges of the large building sitting
just to the southeast.  The city wall runs north and south here,
following along the edge of the crescent and casting its shadow on the
road.
55932.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: A damp musky odour greets all who enter this large dome.  Stained
glass creates a roof to the dome, bringing in a beautiful pattern of
light and colour.  This is the famous shop, Sorcerous Sundries, where
many a mage can go to buy ingredients for potions, study secret arcane
knowledge with one of the local experts, or just browse a selection of
goods.
55841.name: Sorcerous Sundries

description: Jammed with desks, shelves, cabinets and people, the Harbour
Master's building is never quiet.  Voices cry out as people struggle
to hold their own conversations over the din of the crowd as captains,
merchants, clerks, and apprentices all do their business.  Every desk
in the place is covered with mounds of paper and books, and the walls
are covered with means of keeping records.
55914.name: {DThe {YH{yarbour {YM{yaster{Y'{ys {DBuilding{x

description: A small and narrow alleyway branches off the road to the north.
Over to the west a large dome can be seen, with a stained glass roof.
The Road of Travellers continues east to west.
55814.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Making its way north, Balduran Way branches off a T-intersection.
Opening to the east is a narrow, dark alley, and to the west is
Merchant's Way, a bustling street often filled with activity.  There
is a small building to the south, a dark window facing the
intersection.
55833.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: At the edge of the city, Harbour Road winds along the shoreline,
attractive for tourtists and useful for marchants.  The sea goes on
for miles to the south, spreading out disappearing over the horizon,
and the constant sound of the waves drifts through the air.  Running
between the water and the road, a stone wall stands a few feet high
and keeps the tide from breaking onto the shore.
55880.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DHarbour Road{x

description: Close to the Central Gatehouse, the street sees much use from all
sorts of people.  At the busiest times of day, the street is packed,
leading from all areas of the southern city to the connection to the
north.  A row of houses is to the north, small and quaint homes, and a
building stands to the south, facing the other direction.
55907.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: The Road of Travellers is now emerging to be a large circle, as it
turns eastward.  Those who have travelled the whole road will end up
where they started.  It is used to get around the main southeast
corner of the big city.
55818.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Here the Tradesman's Route ends, and the road splits into a
T-junction.  Cloakwood Close runs along the city wall to the east and
a shadowy alley runs to the west towards the city center.
55804.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.
55835.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: Lined with trees and small homes to the north, the South Central
Corridor runs through the center of the city.  The street blocks are
maintained well, scuffed but clean, barely showing the amount of use
put to the road.  To the south stands the headquarters of the Flaming
Fist, a large building dotted with windows that face over the
corridor.
55930.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: The large, carefully-maintained road is lined with lamp posts, a
long inn building to the north.  Its windows are partly covered by
transluscent curtains, warm lights glowing in the windows after dark.
To the south, a smaller street meets the Corridor in a T intersection,
the start of Flaming Fist Crescent.
55910.name: {YB{yaldur{y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DThe Central Corridor{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55917.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: The South Central Corridor, one of Baldur's Gate's most used
streets, begins here.  So close to Market Square, the din of the market
can easily be heard during the day.  Coming and going, merchants and
patrons often crowd the street, and booths spill out of the square and
onto the street as merchants hock their wares.
55889.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55847.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: Jammed with desks, shelves, cabinets and people, the Harbour
Master's building is never quiet.  Voices cry out as people struggle
to hold their own conversations over the din of the crowd as captains,
merchants, clerks, and apprentices all do their business.  Every desk
in the place is covered with mounds of paper and books, and the walls
are covered with means of keeping records.
55913.name: {DThe {YH{yarbour {YM{yaster{Y'{ys {DBuilding{x

description: Every bit the shack by the sea, the walls are littered with fishing
nets and boating gear.  A broad display case toward the back shows off
various smaller items, a large fish mounted on the wall behind it.
When the weather is nice, the door is kept open, letting in the sound
of the surf and the rich tang of salt water in the air.  A small door
on the back wall is propped open, giving a glimpse into a cluttered
stockroom.
55915.name: {YD{yocker's {GG{general {GS{gtore{x

description: {DThis alleyway is very narrow.  There are tall fences running up
along both sides of the path.  The back room of the Elfsong is visible
over one of the fences to the east.  Sorcerous Sundries is over to the
west behind a stone wall.  {x
55827.name: {DA{Y N{yarrow{D Alley{x

description: A small intersection connects Trademan's Route with Commoner's
Road, the smaller passage branching off into the large street.  The
city wall turns in a sharp corner, running west and south, a small
grove of trees clustered beside the road.
55861.name: {YC{yommoner{y'{ys {YP{yassage{x

description: {g     {G.{g-{G"{g`.-{G'{g-.       {wThis road alongside the eastern city wall
{g  .-'.-.%_.- {G,{g )  {wof Baldur's Gate is lined with beautiful and
{g (_{G.{g ){R%{g(  .'{R%{g  ,) {wtall oak trees. They cast an inviting shadow
{g   (.-, {R%{g)'{G.{g _.)  {wdown on the cobblestone  pathway below.  The
{g    '-.{y%{g\{y%{g/-{G'     {wroad is named after Cloakwood. This shadowed
{y        %%        {wand dark  forest is located southwest of the
{y        %%        {wcity.  The trees are grown from acorns found
{g      .,{y%%{g._     {win Cloakwood, some say they are magical.{x
55808.name: {YC{yloakwood {YC{ylose{x

description: Running alongside the city wall, a narrow street breaks away from
the Road of Travelers.  The coast is just to the south, a low wall
breaking the tide, and to the east a tall turret juts up from the
wall.  A small building sits to the west, and beyond it the sounds of
the dockyards echo.
55851.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: A tall turret in the city wall stands to the south.  The Road of
Travellers continues to the west.  There are several tracks in the
road indicating travel is quite popular here.
55824.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Shielded from the spray of the sea by Umberlee's temple, the narrow
road follows the wall of the temple along the shore.  Though difficult
to see, the sound of the sea is easily heard as it laps against the
far side of the temple.  The air is thick with the scent of salt water
and the cries of seagulls, and the sounds from the docks can be heard
in the distance.
55887.name: {bU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{B'{bs {YP{yassage{x

description: There is a nasty smell rising from a grate at the edge of the road
here.  The road runs alongside the large turret in the city walls, now
to the east.
55823.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Starting to narrow to the south, the street is wide and well used.
A small path breaks off to the east toward the dockyards, which are
surrounded by a tall, weathered fence.  A large opening in the fence
allows crates and cargo to be taken to the harbour.  Breaking against
the short wall, the tide rolls in and out, and the calls of the
dockyard workers drift over the fence.
55858.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: A scenic side street, the path is made of decorative cobblestone,
making its ways south toward the sea.  The calls of seagulls echo
through the air as the surf can be heard in the distance.  Down the
road the Temple of Umberlee can be seen standing its vigil by the
water, and a small, boarded up house is just off the path.
55900.name: {DThe {YS{youth {YP{yath{x

description: This part of the Road of Travellers is the least pleasant.  There
is much noise coming from the dockyards, and the local drunks from the
Blade and Stars tend to act a little violently to passers by.
55820.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Distant from the market, the faint sounds of merchants can be heard
faintly.  To the south, the Iron Throne and the Harbour Master's
building both stand, a dark alley running between the two toward the
sea.  The alley is uncluttered, and the shadows seem to shift,
watching those who pass by.
55891.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: The alley ends here, as it joins onto Balduran Way to the west.
That street is named after Balduran, the founder of the city.  A small
narrow passageway leads to another alley south of here, while the
entrance to a small house is north.
55829.name: {DShadow's Alley{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55925.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55935.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: A large thoroughfair for the citizens of Baldur's Gate, Balduran
Way is a wide and busy street.  The stones of the road are dirty and
worn but the street is kept even.  Small houses on the east side of
the road are built together into a large building; to the west is a
row of small, old homes.
55870.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: With the dockyards to one side and the sea to the other, the narrow
street is both scenic and loud.  A tall fence cordons off the
dockyards to the north, mountains of crates and other goods visible
through the cracks.  Between the street and fence is a broad stretch
where bards are known to set up, giving this crescent its name as they
perform their music and their tales above the sound of the water.
55855.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: Bard's Crescent continues alongside the sea, the water stretching
out for miles to the south.  Small and inviting, a store sits on the
opposite side of the street.  A small boat is propped up in front of
the store, tied securely to its stand.  Seagulls often perch on the
roof of the store, scattering at each echoing crash from the nearby
dockyards.
55854.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

description: {*A dark and cramped alleyway, it is tucked out of the way and yet
commonly used by locals as a quick route from the Central Gatehouse to
the harbour.  The walls of the Iron Throne press in close on one side,
casting a deep shadow over the alley, and garbage clutters the ground.
Sounds of rats scurrying are common, as is a damp chill in the air
from never seeing the sun.  {x
55898.name: {YC{yut{Y-{ythrough {YA{ylley{x

description: The Corridor continues along past the row of houses to the north, a
tall tree standing in one yard.  Breaking off to the south, a narrow
alley works its way between the Iron Throne and a small shop, broad
enough for only a couple humans shoulder to shoulder.  Well shadowed
from the sun, even on the brightest day the alley is dim and unlit.
55896.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55934.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55933.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Broad and well kept, the Corridor passes by the tall bulk of the
Iron Throne, a cold and unwelcoming building.  Makou-powers lamps
light the street at night, standing at intervals along the street.  To
the north, the row of houses comes to an end, the Central Gatehouse
sitting just to the west.
55894.name: {DThe {YS{youth {DCentral {YC{yorridor{x

description: A small path from Bard's Crescent leads into the dockyards of
Baldur's Gate.  Here, many dock workers work to keep the shipping
system in the harbour working efficiently.  Crates are processed,
goods are prepared for loading onto the ships and many dock workers
busily move about the road.
55941.name: {wD{Dockyards

description: The cobblestone road runs southward along the great eastern city
wall.  There is a small house to the west.  Noise from the Elfsong
Tavern can be heard coming from the northwest.
55825.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Streets come together here to form a vast, open market.  The air is
filled with the sounds of the nearby harbour, and during the day the
calls of merchants lift above the din of a gathered crowd.  As an open
market, there are no set booths, but travellers and locals alike hock
their wears to each day's crowd.  Though most is typical, more rare
finds can be made as merchants from all parts pass through the city,
and the mix of local and foreign products keeps the crowd coming for
more.  The Harbour Master's building stands just to the west.
55879.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DMarket Square{x

description: This is Shadow's Alley, a narrow little road, which is kept in
constant shadow.  Either the high rising elfsong tavern to the south
or the houses to the north create an obstacle to the sun's light.
55831.name: {DShadow's Alley{x

description: A broad and tree-lined street, the crescent runs around the
headquarters of the Flaming Fist, mercenary company and unofficial
army of Baldur's Gate.  In the center of the crescent, the large
building stands two stories tall, crossed windows dotting its walls
and overlooking the road.  Despite being so near the Fist's
headquarters, the street is peaceful, used by few other than those of
the company and the odd tourist seeking out the home of the well known
band of mercenaries.
55937.name: {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x {YC{yrescent{x

description: Trailing beside the coast, separated from the water by a low wall,
South Street is a popular tourist spot.  The view of the sea to the
south seems to extend forever, the water disappearing over the horizon
and shimmering with reflected light.  Softly, the sound of the waves
breaking on the shore echoes, complemented by the occaisional call of
seagulls.  There is the rich scent of the sea lingering in the air.
55904.name: {YS{youth {YS{ytreet{x

description: A broad, well-used street, Trademan's Route runs along the city
wall.  Small cracks scatter the road, but it is well kept.  Small
trees are planted between the route and the wall.  To the west, a
number of small houses appear joined together into a large building.
Its windows are covered, giving no glimpse inside.  A small path
branches off toward the Eastern Gatehouse.
55802.name: {YT{yradesman{Y'{ys {YR{youte{x

description: The city walls run right up to the edge of the road here, forcing
the path to divert to the north, while the rest of the Road of
Travellers runs along westward.  There is an old cart here, empty of
its contents, perhaps abandoned a long time ago.
55822.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Lined with trees, this broad street is clean but well-used, the
stones showing only small signs of their wear.  As it winds its way
across the city, it passes many smaller homes and shops.  At almost
all hours someone can be found wandering this street, either on their
way to and from the market or the harbour.
55872.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: This unpleasant alley between two very tall buildings is not for
the tourist.  Garbage rots in gutters at the side of the footpath.
Beggars and drunks pester people for spare change, or just wander
around making a nuicence of themselves.
55893.name: {DAssassin's Alley

description: The coastline curves here, the street following it in a gentle arc.
As it turns, the road becomes wider, opening to accomodate the traffic
from the nearby dockyards to the harbour and the market.  Stretching
out to the horizon, the oceans laps against the shore and breaks into
a low wall that follows the street.
55857.name: {YB{yard{Y'{ys {YC{yrescent{x

{g      .,{y%%{g._     {win Cloakwood, some say they are magical.{x
55806.name: {YC{yloakwood {YC{ylose{x

description: The musky odour is at its worst here.  There are so many pieces of
parchment and paper for scroll making that the smell is so pungent.
The stained glass dome is reflecting colours down through to the room
making it look somewhat spectacular.  Sitting at their desk, a young
lady sells scrolls.
55842.name: Sorcerous Sundries

description: A second, smaller fireplace is central to this room.  Tables and
chairs sit everywhere, covered in scrolls and books and bottles of
ink.  Bookshelves line the walls, tomes of assorted sizes and ages
gracing them; there are obvious spots where books are missing.  Piled
in the corner is a small collection of matts used for meditation, the
pile untidy and much used.
55945.name: {DDruidic {GT{geachings{x

description: Several rows of book cases now line the floor in the northwest
quadrant of the dome.  The beautiful stained glass roof casts
colourful and interesting shadows along the rows of book cases.  In
the centre of the book cases is a small open section where an ancient
elven mage reads, studies and meditates.  This is obviously a place
where mages and wizards can train.
55843.name: Sorcerous Sundries

description: {DThis alleyway is very narrow.  There are tall fences running up
along both sides of the path.  The back room of the Elfsong is visible
over one of the fences to the east.  Sorcerous Sundries is over to the
west behind a stone wall.  {x
55826.name: {DA{Y N{yarrow{D Alley{x

description: Here lies the junction of the Road of Travellers with Bard's
Crescent, which lies off to the south.  Over to the east, the city
walls lie, and there is a fairly large turret just at the end of the
road.
55821.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: {*A dark and cramped alleyway, it is tucked out of the way and yet
commonly used by locals as a quick route from the Central Gatehouse to
the harbour.  The walls of the Iron Throne press in close on one side,
casting a deep shadow over the alley, and garbage clutters the ground.
Sounds of rats scurrying are common, as is a damp chill in the air
from never seeing the sun.  {x
55897.name: {YC{yut{Y-{ythrough {YA{ylley{x

description: {x

55800.name: {DThe {YE{yastern {YG{yatehouse{x

description: Lined with trees, this broad street is clean but well-used, the
stones showing only small signs of their wear.  As it winds its way
across the city, it passes many smaller homes and shops.  At almost
all hours someone can be found wandering this street, either on their
way to and from the market or the harbour.
55873.name: {YM{yerchant{Y'{ys {YW{yay{x

description: This small house has been converted into a shop.  The front room
has had shelves and cabinets added so that the stock can be displayed.
The stock is very varied and most of it looks like it is a pile of
junk.  However, a few nice trinkets attract the attention of most
greedy bargain hunters.
55948.name: Folly's Famous Discount Dealings

description: Jammed with desks, shelves, cabinets and people, the Harbour
Master's building is never quiet.  Voices cry out as people struggle
to hold their own conversations over the din of the crowd as captains,
merchants, clerks, and apprentices all do their business.  Every desk
in the place is covered with mounds of paper and books, and the walls
are covered with means of keeping records.
55912.name: {DThe {YH{yarbour {YM{yaster{Y'{ys {DBuilding{x

description: Streets come together here to form a vast, open market.  The air
is filled with the sounds of the nearby harbour, and during the day
the calls of merchants lift above the din of a gathered crowd.  As an
open market, there are no set booths, but travellers and locals alike
hock their wears to each day's crowd.  Though most is typical, more
rare finds can be made as merchants from all parts pass through the
city, and the mix of local and foreign products keeps the crowd coming
for more.
55876.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DMarket Square{x

description: At the edge of the city, Harbour Road winds along the shoreline,
attractive for tourtists and useful for marchants.  The sea goes on
for miles to the south, spreading out disappearing over the horizon,
and the constant sound of the waves drifts through the air.  Running
between the water and the road, a stone wall stands a few feet high
and keeps the tide from breaking onto the shore.
55881.name: {YB{yaldur{Y'{ys {YG{yate{g: {DHarbour Road{x

description: A large thoroughfair for the citizens of Baldur's Gate, Balduran
Way is a wide and busy street.  The stones of the road are dirty and
worn but the street is kept even.  Small houses on the east side of
the road are built together into a large building; to the west is a
row of small, old homes.
55867.name: {YB{yalduran {YW{yay{x

description: Many people pass along this road.  The cobblestones look well worn
by travellers and carts.  There is a couple of barrels left at the
side of the road here, empty but still smelling of ale.
55813.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Separating the northern and south sections of the city, the Central
Gatehouse is large but simplistic.  During the day, there is little
restriction to passing between the two halves of Baldur's Gate, and
the guards treat the post as a simple assignment.
55947.name: {DThe {YC{yentral {YG{yatehouse{x

description: Despite being well lit, there is a feeling of secrecy in the air.
A building of much business, there are files and desks everywhere.
The building seems smaller from within than it did outside, though
this may be from the number of filing cabinets set along the walls.
Weapons along with records adorn the walls, a reminder that the Iron
Throne is not an average mercantile organization.
55845.name: {8The {yI{rr{yo{rn {8Throne{x

description: Branching off to the west is the beginning of Merchant's Way.  This
leads along to the Harbour of Baldur's Gate.  The Road of Travellers
continues to the south towards the dockyards.
55817.name: {YR{yoad {Dof {YT{yravellers{x

description: Shielded from the spray of the sea by Umberlee's temple, the
narrow road follows the wall of the temple along the shore.  Though
difficult to see, the sound of the sea is easily heard as it laps
against the far side of the temple.  The air is thick with the scent
of salt water and the cries of seagulls, and the sounds from the docks
can be heard in the distance.
55902.name: {DThe {YS{youth {YP{yath{x

description: This is Shadow's Alley, a narrow little road, which is kept in
constant shadow.  Either the high rising elfsong tavern to the south
or the houses to the north create an obstacle to the sun's light.
55832.name: {DShadow's Alley{x

description:
Brevyre is a short young woman.  She is fairly gaunt and thin,
inidcative of a lifetime spent reading and studying rather than
training in combat.
55808.name: Brevyre~

description:
{DThis man has an evil glint in his eyes.  He is wearing a long
thick black robe, with a hood pulled over his head.  He is carrying a
staff that glows green with an evil aura.  Best beware of him.  {x
55809.name: {DT{wr{Wa{Dn {rthe {DNe{wcr{Woma{wnc{Der{x~

description:
Nemphre is an old man, with a curled white beard.  He is wearing
white canvass robes, stained in some parts with a little blood.
55810.room_name: An old man wearing white robes is here conjuring spells.
55810.name: {WN{we{cm{Dp{ch{wr{We{x~

55812.name: {rA {DH{we{Wlm{we{Dd {RH{rorror{x~
subroutines:
F for AV
F par ABCGHIJK

description:
Rugged and fit, he stands proudly, eyes scanning the crowd that
passes through the gatehouse.  He wears a polished breastplate and
leather breeches, sword hanging at his side.  Though his stance is
casual, slight tension in his muscles shows that he is ready for
battle at a moment's notice.
55813.room_name: Standing at alert, a gatehouse guard watches passersby silently.
55813.name: a gatehouse guard~

55814.d_flags: D {csighs at his bad fortune as he falls to the ground.{x~
description:
Wearing a tshirt and shorts, he stands average height and is
wide-eyed as he wanders the city.  His well groomed hair is dusty
brown, his features indescript, and he is slightly underweight. 
Dotted with scars, his complexion is ruddy, pot-marked from
adolescence.  Looking slightly out of place, in a crowd he would be
simply another face, pleasant but unmemorable.
55814.room_name: A tourist is standing here and looking around.
55814.name: a tourist~

55815.d_flags: D {cspits in disgust at the circumstances.{x~
description:
With her nose slightly upturned, she tries unsuccessfully to look
bored at the sights that surround her.  There is not a single red hair
out of place on her head as it cascades down around her face.  Her
dress is long, lace-trimming burgundy, and she wears high heels that
make her look taller than she is.  Somewhat overweight, her arms are
thick but her waist oddly slender, and she looks as though she is
having difficult breathing.
55815.room_name: A tourist stands here, looking around.
55815.name: a tourist~

55816.d_flags: D Stumbles and falls against the wall.~
description:
Wrapped in a dirty cloak, he crouches in the alley and stares
bleakly at any who pass with glazed eyes.  His face is drawn, covered
in unkempt stubble, and his black hair has grown shaggy and hangs in
grime.  Strong features and a thin build would have made him handsome,
if the circumstances were different.  There is a shake to his hand and
an uncertainty to how he crouches, and the stench of beer lingers
around him.
55816.room_name: Begging for money, a man crouches in the shadows pitifully.
55816.name: a beggar~

description:
Dressed in white, he wanders the city enjoying a moment of peace in
his busy life.  His hair is blonde and his skin richly tanned from
hours in the sun at sea.  Muscular and fit, he is a large man that
could not be mistaken for overweight.  Calloused hands hang at his
sides, thumbs hooked into his pockets, and a dagger is tied to his
belt.
55817.name: a sailor~

55818.d_flags: D Trips over his own feet, impaling himself on his dagger.~
description:
Clothes wrinkled and stained, he stands as though he could fall at
any moment.  Though he is tall, he hunches slightly, waving
uncertainly on his feet.  His tan complexion is flushed red and his
broad smile is a little crooked.  Covering his head is a short fuzz of
black hair, matching his neatly trimmed goatee.
55818.room_name: Weaving uncertainly, a sailor stands here.
55818.name: a sailor~

description:
A tall and imposing figure, he is hardly a man one would want to
meet in a dark alley alone.  His arms are thick and muscular, his
features chiseled, and he holds him self with unspoken confidence. 
There is warmth in his brown eyes, however, and a slight smile touches
his lips as he passes strangers with a friendly nod.  A long dagger
with an ornate handle hangs at his side.
55819.room_name: A tall sea captain wanders past casually.
55819.name: a captain~

55820.d_flags: D Makes a final, failing attack as he dies.~
description:
With a cold look, he eyes every outsider who makes their way into
the Iron Throne's seat in Baldur's Gate.  His hair is midnight black,
cut short and trimmed neatly around his ears.  Slate blue, his eyes
are calculating and guarded, and a scar cuts below his right eye. 
Though he is a merchant, he is strongly built, a rugged look to him in
the scruff bear he wears and the strength in his coiled muscles.
55820.room_name: An agent of the Iron Throne gives you a cold look.
55820.name: an Iron Throne agent~

55821.d_flags: D Lunges at you with her dying strength and falls short.~
description:
Red hair pulled back into a tight pony tail, she leans against the
wall with her arms crossed and watches the crowd casually.  Her
features are delicate, but nothing of her stubborn expression is. 
With a barely existant figure, she is well muscled and strongly built,
her clothes fitting just loosely enough to allow for movement.  A
sabre hangs at her side, never out of her quick reach.
55821.room_name: Standing by the door is a guard for the Iron Throne.
55821.name: an Iron Throne guard~

55822.d_flags: D Growls a curse and stumbles backward.~
description:
Large from both muscles and fat, he has a beer gut and arms thick
as tree trunks.  Sweat and streaks of dirt cover his clean-shaven
face, and his hands are thickly calloused from hours of work.  He
wears a stained white shirt and ragged jeans, clunky black boots
covering his feet.
55822.room_name: A burly dockyard worker bustles about.
55822.name: a dockyard worker~

description:
Wearing a marked-up fishing vest and a sailor's cap, he grins
broadly at everyone who comes through the door.  His tousled blonde
hair and impish face make him look younger than he is, and his dangly
form looks barely out of adolesence.  He has a deep tan and strong
features.
55823.room_name: Docker stands here promoting his wares.
55823.name: Docker~

description:
She is a petite elderly woman, her silver hair cut short and styled
in tight curls.  The lines around her eyes are deep, her lips turned
up in a friendly smile.  The sun dress she wears is similar to that in
the front window, sleeveless and bright green.
55824.room_name: Behind the counter, Sally nods to each new customer entering the store.
55824.name: Sally~

description:
He wears a loose pair of breeches and a plain tunic, his strong
frame carried easily.  Well muscled, his arms and legs hold implied
strength, a deep tan coloring his skin.  His eyes, a friendly green,
are filled with kindness and knowledge as they appraise those who
enter his abode.  Long and black, his hair is woven in a tight braid
down his back.
55825.room_name: A well traveled strider rests here, waiting to teach.
55825.name: Radasi~

description:
Thin and tall, she understates her figure with the loose robes she
wears.  Her shoulder-length hair is a mud-brown mass of subtle waves
that tangled if they are looked at the wrong way, and her features of
strongly defined.  Her eyes are piercing green, and her legs are long
and leanly muscled.
55826.room_name: A woman sits cross-legged on a matt, meditating.
55826.name: Lana~

description:
She is slender yet muscular, her long legs leanly muscled.  Her
hair is short and spiky, a rich brown that accents her shimmering
hazel eyes.  To allow her movement, her clothing fits snuggly to her
athletic figure.  She leans against the wall, her hands tucked into
her back pockets, and casually appraises everyone who enters the
academy.
55827.room_name: Leaning against the wall is a slender woman.
55827.name: Carella~

55828.d_flags: D Tosses his club to the ground in defeat.~
description:
He stands proudly, looking young and eager in the armor that marks
him a member of the Flaming Fist.  His face has yet to be marked by
battle, his lips turned up in a friendly smile and his fair short and
black.  Hanging from a holster on his belt is a club, and he idly
plays with it from time to time, looking about for an excuse to use it
and test his skills.
55828.room_name: A cadet stands here bearing the armor of the {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x.
55828.name: a cadet of the {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x~

55829.d_flags: D Clutches her moneypurse protectively as she falls.~
description:
There is a foreign beauty to this traveling merchant.  Her skin is
a rich and golden brown, accented by the soft brown of her eyes.  High
cheekbones and a petite nose give her a gentle look, and her build is
slight.  Falling past her shoulders, her black hair hangs in many thin
braids, each with a bead at its end.
55829.room_name: Exploring the city is a traveling merchant.
55829.name: a traveling merchant~

55830.d_flags: D Falls to his knees and punches the ground angrily.~
description:
Fidgetting nervously, he looks no more than 13 years old.  His face
is boyish, his blonde hair dirty and rustled, and his figure clings to
the lankiness of youth.  He wears a ripped shirt and worn breeches,
and he clutches a dagger tightly in one shaking hand.  There is a hint
of desperation in his sad, green eyes.
55830.room_name: A young boy is hiding in the shadows.
55830.name: a thief~

55831.d_flags: D Calls out for help and stumbles backward.~
description:
In a casual suit, he stands apart from everyone else in the
building.  He is slightly balding, his dark hair beginning to turn
silver, and he wears a pair of thin wire spectacles low on his nose. 
His lips turn up in a friendly smile, and he has a slight pot belly,
looking jolly.
55831.room_name: The Harbour Master stands here looking busy.
55831.name: the harbour master~

55832.d_flags: D Stumbles, trying desperately not to fall on her instrument.~
description:
She carries her own chair when she goes out to play, a small,
folding wooden piece scratched and banged and dented.  Her hair is
long and raven black, her eyes a friendly blue, and her features
rugged.  Long, delicate fingers play her lute, and she sings from time
to time, her voice a light soprano.
55832.room_name: A bard rests here, playing her lute softly.
55832.name: a bard~

55833.d_flags: D Howls in fury as he dies.~
description:
A strong looking man dressed in full platemail stands here guarding
the entrance to the fine city of Baldur's Gate.  He looks at you as
you come closer and hails you.
55833.room_name: A tall knight stands here in full platemail of the {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x.
55833.name: a tall Knight~

55834.d_flags: D Honks and dives forward, biting its killer's finger.~
description:
Chat It's a goose.  But not just any goose, a wild goose!  Running
around Baldur's Gate, it could be found anywhere, and yet no one has
any idea how it got here...
55834.room_name: A wild goose honks at you loudly.
55834.name: a {*w{wild{x {*g{woose{x~

description:
This man looks fat and wealthy.  He obviously makes a tidy profit
on his goods.  There is something odd about him though.  He is not the
most trustworthy of people.
55801.room_name: A Shady Merchant looks over to you and invites you into his shop.
55801.name: a Shady Merchant~

description:
A tall, gaunt halfelf dress in dark clothes, loosely fitting, but
not so loose as to get in the way of a fight.
55802.room_name: A {wM{Dan{x hiding away in the {wS{Dhadows{x stares at you intently, never taking his eyes off you.
55802.name: {wA S{Dhady {wM{Dan{x~

55803.room_name: A Wise old Wizard rests behind an alchemist's bench preparing potions.
55803.name: a Wise Old Wizard~

description:
You look at an old elf.  He is wearing a dark blue robe with a hood
covering most of his face.  He appears to be very wise, and willing to
train younger wizards and mages.
55804.room_name: An {CA{cn{gc{Gi{ge{cn{Ct {WE{wlven {CM{ca{gg{Ge{x rests here waiting to train wizards.
55804.name: An {CA{cn{gc{Gi{ge{cn{Ct {WE{wlven {CM{ca{gg{Ge{x~
subroutines:
M SPEECH 55807 train~
M SPEECH 55807 practice~
M GREET 55806 100~
M FIGHT 55805 100~

description:
{DThis cat is small, but somewhat strong looking.  It has a glint in
it's eyes making it look distinctly more intelligent than normal
felines, as it is the familiar of the shopkeeper here.  {x
55805.name: A {DBlack Cat{x~
subroutines:
M RANDOM 55804 10~
M DELAY 55803 100~
M GREET 55802 100~

55806.room_name: Wandmaker, Chalmina the Enchantress is here to sell some of her wands.
55806.name: Chalmina the Enchantress~

description:
You look at an old elf.  He is wearing a dark blue robe with a hood
covering most of his face.  He appears to be very wise, and willing to
train younger wizards and mages.
55807.room_name: An {CA{cn{gc{Gi{ge{cn{Ct {WE{wlven {CM{ca{gg{Ge{x rests here waiting to train wizards.
55807.name: An {CA{cn{gc{Gi{ge{cn{Ct {WE{wlven {CM{ca{gg{Ge{x~
